page.title: 01INTRODUCTION-BRAMSHAW AREA
page.content: Typically N.F.,only 16 dwellings,has both woodland enclosures and moorland. Includes highest point of NF (Pipers Wait) and edge of conservation area of Fritham village. E half has forest & farm land & villages of Brook and Bramshaw. Two main types of population: 1) Those who work in area, often of old Forest stock eg. Commoners with smallholdings, keepers, agisters, foresters, those working in hotels or golf courses. 2) Those who worked in business or professions in neighbouring towns and villages, many now retired. The two groups have different backgrounds but share a natural conservatism which unites them in preserving fragile environment of NF.They may, of course, differ as how best to achieve this.
